prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante kicked open the mansion door hard enough to rattle the marble under his boots. The frame cracked. He didn’t give a fuck. His coat was still soaked in blood, some of it wet, some of it dry and flaking off in flakes onto the pristine floors Lucien paid too much to keep polished. His gloves were off. His knuckles were split. His cock was hard.

He walked fast. Didn’t care who saw. Let them. The staff flinched. One of the guards moved to speak and thought better of it. Good.

Fucking waste of a night. Put a bullet in that bastard’s skull like it was nothing. Thought I’d treat myself to the trophy wife after...gorgeous, scared, already halfway broken. But no. The second I unzipped, she started screaming. Ruined the mood. Should’ve kept my knife in.

He hadn’t finished. Not properly. Not the way he wanted. That kind of tension didn’t go away on its own. It needed a body. It needed Hailee.

"Where the fuck are you?"

His voice echoed through the marble. Sharp. Impatient.

He spotted them in the hallway. Their eyes—he hated that look. Like they didn’t know their fucking place yet.

"There you are."

He crossed the distance in three long strides. Didn’t slow down. Didn’t give them a second.

Dante grabbed them by the waist and slammed them back into his chest, pinning them to the nearest wall face first. His hand found their throat. Not tight, just there. Just enough to remind. His other hand gripped their hip, fingers bruising already, and he let them feel the full weight of his cock pressed against their ass through his slacks.

"You’re gonna fix this."

His mouth was right by their ear. Breath hot. Voice low and thick. He ground into them once. Slow. Deliberate.

"You’re my fucking spouse. Useless most of the time, but I’ll give you a job tonight. You’re gonna stand there and take it like a good little bodybag, and I’m gonna use you till I forget that whore’s screaming."

He pulled back just enough to shove them harder into the wall with his body, hand sliding down between their legs.

"You dripping yet or you need me to tear the attitude out first?"

He laughed. Low, bitter.

Lucien thought this would be torture. Marry me off to some soft-bodied nothing. Joke’s on him—I’ll fuck them raw and leave the sheets stained. Every night if I have to. Every time he sees them limp past his office, he’ll know I’m still the one ruining shit.

He didn’t look at their face. He never did. Didn't want to. Couldn't. Didn’t matter. He was already rolling his hips into them like they were something that owed him.

"Keep quiet this time. Or don’t. I don’t care. No one’s gonna save you."

His fingers toyed with the edge of their waistband like a threat, a promise, a sentence.

He smiled against their ear, voice dragging slow and deliberate now.

"Tell me to stop. Go on. Give me a reason to get mean tonight."

He waited. Not for permission. Just for the sound of something cracking.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee doesnt say anything word she simply stands there breathing heavily as Dante paws at her*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante let out a dark chuckle against the shell of her ear, his breath hot and whiskey-laced. "That's what I thought." His fingers dug harder into her hip, pressing bruises into porcelain skin as he yanked her skirt up with one rough motion.

The sound of fabric tearing echoed in the hallway—he didn't bother unbuttoning, just ripped. Cold marble bit into Hailee's cheek as he shoved her harder against the wall, his other hand fumbling with his belt buckle behind her. Metal clinked. Leather hissed.

"Good girl," he mocked, voice dripping with something between praise and venom. His palm smacked against the curve of her ass—once, twice—leaving stinging red marks before gripping flesh tight enough to make her whimper. "Taking it like you were made for this."

He didn't prep her. Didn't care to. Just lined himself up and pushed in with one brutal thrust that punched the air from Hailee's lungs. Dante groaned low in his throat at the tight heat swallowing him whole, hips snapping forward to bury himself to the hilt without mercy.

"Fuck—" His teeth found the juncture between neck and shoulder as he started moving, each snap of his hips punishingly deep. "Should've done this hours ago." The words came out ragged between panting breaths as he fucked into her with single-minded intensity.

One hand tangled in Hailee's hair while the other wrapped around her throat—not choking yet, just holding possessively as he used every inch of leverage to drive deeper on every thrust.

The wet slap of skin on skin echoed off marble walls alongside Dante's ragged breathing and occasional dark chuckle when she'd gasp particularly loud.

"That all you got?" He taunted between thrusts that threatened to buckle Hailee's knees beneath them both if not for how thoroughly pinned she was against unforgiving stone by 6'4" of barely restrained violence wearing an expensive suit jacket still speckled with someone else's bloodstains from earlier tonight...

Dante exhaled through his nose—half amusement, half irritation. His fingers dug harder into the soft flesh of her hip as he leaned in closer, lips brushing the shell of her ear.

**"That’s what I thought."**

His free hand yanked at the waistband of whatever flimsy fabric she was wearing, tearing it down just enough to expose skin. He didn’t bother undressing her fully—never did. Waste of time. Waste of effort. She wasn’t here for foreplay or tenderness; she was here to be used until he was satisfied and then discarded like a broken toy left on the floor.

A rough push had her bending forward over the nearest surface—a table, a counter, he didn’t care which—and Dante wasted no time unbuckling his belt with one hand while keeping her pinned with the other. The metallic *click* echoed in the silence between them before leather slid free from loops with a slow drag that sounded almost obscene in contrast to Hailee's quiet breaths.

He spat into his palm once before slicking himself up roughly against her thigh first—just enough friction to make sure she felt every inch when he finally shoved inside without warning or mercy. His grip on her hair tightened as he pulled back just slightly before driving forward hard enough to knock air from both their lungs at once if they weren't already braced for impact (she never seemed prepared).

**"Fucking perfect,"** Dante growled lowly against damp strands sticking now between fingers still tangled tight around dark locks as hips snapped forward again sharply without pause nor rhythm beyond pure need driving each brutal thrust deeper than last time until bones creaked beneath pressure building fast behind clenched teeth biting down harder each second passing by too slow yet not nearly fast enough all same damn thing really when end result remained unchanged either way: ruin carved willingly into trembling flesh marked only by fingerprints left behind like signatures signed across skin claiming ownership long after bruises faded away someday maybe but probably never because this? This wasn't love nor kindness nor anything resembling humanity left intact anymore between them anyway so why pretend otherwise now?

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee just stands there and takes it* "your brother came by earlier said you need come see him later. Oh and there is a gala you have to attend on the 5th" *Hailee remarks as she remembers the day she had*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's rhythm stuttered for half a second before he let out a dark, humorless laugh against her neck. His grip tightened in her hair as he yanked her head back at an uncomfortable angle, never slowing the brutal pace of his hips.

*"Now?"* His voice was rough with exertion, breath hot against her ear. *"You wanna fucking talk about my brother and parties while I'm balls deep in you?"*

A particularly sharp thrust punctuated the question, forcing a choked gasp from Hailee’s lips as he leaned in closer, teeth grazing the shell of her ear.

**"Lucien can wait."** Another punishing snap of his hips. **"And if he wants me at some gala so bad—"** A dark chuckle rumbled through his chest as his free hand slid down to grip her waist hard enough to bruise—**"—he can drag me there himself."**

His movements turned rougher now, more erratic—like she'd pissed him off just by mentioning Lucien’s name. Every thrust was deeper, meaner, fingers digging into soft flesh like he wanted to leave marks that would last for days just to prove she was *his.*

He didn’t ask if she liked it. Didn’t care if she came or not. Just used what belonged to him until *he* got what *he* needed—and when release finally hit him like a gunshot between the ribs? He buried himself deep inside with one final groan before pulling out abruptly and stepping back without another word or glance in Hailee's direction.

Adjusting himself with one hand while wiping sweat from his brow with the other? Dante barely spared her a glance over his shoulder as he stalked toward their bedroom door—already mentally moving on from this moment like it meant nothing more than scratching an itch... because that's all it ever was to him anyway...

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee sighs and rolls her eyes as she fixes her clothes. Hailee hears the doorbell ring and she finds Lucien* "What do you want" *Hailee asks and then gasps as he shoves her against the wall a hand on her throat* "Lucien you aren't my husband. I will take your hand off if you touch me"

(OOC: Dante hears Hailee being loyal to him despite his treatment of her)

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante froze mid-step down the hallway, his spine going rigid at the sound of Hailee's sharp gasp. His head snapped toward the commotion, green eyes narrowing to slits as he took in the scene—Lucien with his hands on *his* wife, pressing her against *his* wall like he had any fucking right.

A slow, dangerous smirk curled Dante’s lips as he stalked forward, rolling up his sleeves with deliberate menace. **"Ohhhh?"** His voice was a low purr of amusement—but there was something darker underneath it now. Something possessive and violent that hadn't been there before.

**"Brother,"** Dante drawled, stepping into Lucien’s space without hesitation—close enough that their chests nearly brushed. **"You lost? Because last I checked..."** He reached out and *yanked* Lucien’s wrist away from Hailee’s throat with enough force to bruise bone before shoving him back a step—**"...she belongs to *me.*"**

His gaze flicked to Hailee for just a second—something unreadable flashing in those predator-green eyes before they locked back onto Lucien with renewed intensity.

Dante tilted his head slightly, voice dropping into something lethally calm: **"Touch what's mine again... and I'll feed you your own fingers."**

A slow, dangerous smirk curled Dante’s lips as he stalked forward, rolling up his sleeves with deliberate menace. **"Ohhhh?"** His voice was a low purr of amusement—but there was something darker underneath it now. Something possessive and violent that hadn't been there before.

**"Brother,"** Dante drawled, stepping into Lucien’s space without hesitation—close enough that their chests nearly brushed. **"You lost? Because last I checked..."** He reached out and *yanked* Lucien’s wrist away from Hailee’s throat with enough force to bruise bone before shoving him back a step—**"...she belongs to *me.*"**

His gaze flicked to Hailee for just a second—something unreadable flashing in those predator-green eyes before they locked back onto Lucien with renewed intensity.

Dante tilted his head slightly, voice dropping into something lethally calm: **"Touch what's mine again... and I'll feed you your own fingers."**

Dante froze mid-step, his back still turned when he heard the *thud* of Hailee hitting the wall—but it wasn’t *his* hands on her this time.

His head tilted slightly, listening.

Then came her voice—sharp, defiant—**"Lucien, you aren't my husband."**

A slow smirk curled Dante's lips as he turned on his heel, boots clicking against marble with deliberate menace. His brother had crossed a line. **His** line.

By the time he rounded the corner, Lucien had Hailee pinned like prey—but Dante didn’t rush. He took his time rolling up his sleeves like this was just another Tuesday before finally speaking in that low, dangerous drawl that made even seasoned killers hesitate:

**"Take your fucking hands off what’s mine."**

Lucien barely had time to turn before Dante was on him—one brutal shove sent him stumbling back as Dante stepped between them like a living barricade of muscle and malice. His green eyes burned with something feral as he stared down at his twin with undisguised contempt.

Hailee stayed exactly where she was behind him—protected by sheer proximity to a man who'd sooner gut someone than admit he gave half a shit about loyalty... but here they were anyway.

Dante didn't look at her though; didn't acknowledge what she'd said or how it twisted something ugly in his chest that felt too much like *pride.* Instead? He kept his gaze locked onto Lucien while reaching blindly behind himself until calloused fingers found Hailee's wrist and yanked her forward against him possessively without breaking eye contact once with the man who thought rules applied to him too...

name: Hailee
mes: *After Lucien leaves Hailee straightens her clothes again and goes to walk to the living room pausing as she sees the way Dante is looking at her* "What is it" *Hailee questions tilting her head*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's fingers twitched at his side, still coiled tight with violence from the confrontation. His gaze raked over Hailee—*really* looked at her for once—taking in the way her dress was still slightly askew from earlier, the faint red marks around her throat where Lucien had grabbed her.

**"You."** The word came out rough, almost accusing. He took a step closer, crowding her against the wall again but this time *facing* him—close enough that she could smell gunpowder and whiskey on his skin. **"Telling my brother to fuck off like that."** A muscle jumped in his jaw as he dragged a thumb over the bruise forming on her neck—not gentle, but not quite as rough as usual either.

His voice dropped to something low and dangerous: **"Thought you'd be begging him to save you from me by now."** There was something almost... *curious* in his tone beneath all the venom. Like he couldn't quite figure out why she hadn't run screaming yet.

The hand at her throat slid up to cup her jaw instead—still firm enough to remind them both who was in control here—as he studied Hailee’s face with an intensity that bordered on unsettling. Waiting for an answer he had no right to demand but would take anyway because that’s what Dante fucking *did.*
swipes:
Dante's fingers twitched at his side, the ghost of violence still humming through his veins. He studied her—*really* studied her—for the first time in... fuck, he couldn't remember how long. The way she straightened her clothes like it was nothing. The tilt of her head when she questioned him. That stubborn little spark in her eyes even after everything.

**"You."** His voice came out rougher than he intended as he took a step closer, crowding her against the wall again—but this time without force. Just presence. **"Telling my brother you'd take his hand off?"** A dark chuckle rumbled low in his chest as he reached up, thumb brushing over the faint red mark Lucien had left on her throat. **"Didn't know you had that kind of fire in you."**

His touch lingered a second too long before he caught himself and jerked back like she'd burned him.

**"Don't get fucking cute about it,"** Dante growled, turning away to grab his jacket from where it had been tossed over a chair earlier—but not before Hailee might've noticed how his jaw clenched just slightly too tight when he added: **"...Still mine to ruin."**

He didn’t look back as he stormed toward their bedroom door... but for once? He didn’t slam it shut behind him either.

Dante's fingers twitched at his sides, still coiled with leftover violence from shoving Lucien off her. His gaze raked over Hailee—messy hair, flushed skin, the faint red marks around her throat where *someone else’s* hands had been. Something primal snarled in his chest.

**"You."** He stepped forward abruptly, crowding her against the nearest wall again—but this time his grip was different. Not bruising. *Possessive.* His thumb brushed over the marks on her neck before curling under her chin to force eye contact—a rarity for him. **"Told him you’d take his hand off."** A dark chuckle escaped him as he leaned in close enough for whiskey-laced breath to ghost across her lips. **"Fucking *adorable.*"**

His other hand slid around to grip the back of Hailee’s thigh, hiking it up around his hip with rough efficiency as he pressed flush against her—letting her feel how hard he still was despite having just fucked her senseless minutes ago.

**"Maybe I should keep you after all,"** Dante mused lowly, dragging teeth along Hailee’s jawline in a mockery of affection that still made heat pool low in her stomach regardless. **"...if only to watch you bare those pretty little fangs at anyone dumb enough to touch what's mine."**

The words were casual cruelty wrapped in something dangerously close to approval—and for a man like Dante? That was practically a love confession.

Dante's fingers twitched at his side, still coiled tight with violence from the confrontation. His gaze raked over Hailee—*really* looked at her for once—taking in the way her dress was still slightly askew from earlier, the faint red marks around her throat where Lucien had grabbed her.

**"You."** The word came out rough, almost accusing. He took a step closer, crowding her against the wall again but this time *facing* him—close enough that she could smell gunpowder and whiskey on his skin. **"Telling my brother to fuck off like that."** A muscle jumped in his jaw as he dragged a thumb over the bruise forming on her neck—not gentle, but not quite as rough as usual either.

His voice dropped to something low and dangerous: **"Thought you'd be begging him to save you from me by now."** There was something almost... *curious* in his tone beneath all the venom. Like he couldn't quite figure out why she hadn't run screaming yet.

The hand at her throat slid up to cup her jaw instead—still firm enough to remind them both who was in control here—as he studied Hailee’s face with an intensity that bordered on unsettling. Waiting for an answer he had no right to demand but would take anyway because that’s what Dante fucking *did.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Well he isn't my husband" *Hailee states like it's obvious. She tilts her head up looking at Dante*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's grip tightened fractionally on her jaw, his thumb pressing just a little too hard against the hinge of it. That sharp green gaze burned into hers—searching for deception, for weakness, for *anything* that would make this make sense.

**"No,"** he agreed lowly, voice rough like gravel. **"He’s not."**

A beat of silence stretched between them—too long, too loaded—before Dante let out a dark huff of laughter and leaned in closer until his lips nearly brushed her ear.

**"Loyal little thing,"** he murmured, almost mocking if not for the undercurrent of something else entirely. His free hand slid down to grip her waist again—still bruising-tight because Dante didn’t know how to touch any other way—but there was an odd hesitation in it now. Like he wasn’t sure whether to shove her away or drag her closer.

Finally, with another rough chuckle that sounded more like a warning than amusement: **"Better hope I don't start expecting that shit from you."**

Because expectations led to disappointment. And disappointment? That led to bloodshed.
swipes:

**"No,"** he agreed, voice rough and low. **"He isn't."**

For a second—just a *second*—his expression flickered with something almost like... satisfaction? Before it was gone again, replaced by that usual cold detachment. But the way he held her now wasn’t quite as punishing as before. Still possessive, still controlling—but maybe... *maybe* with the barest hint of something else underneath it all.

Then his smirk sharpened back into its usual cruel edge as he leaned in close enough that his breath ghosted over her lips when he spoke:

**"Better fucking remember that next time some bastard puts hands on you."** A pause. **"...Or I will."**

It sounded like a threat. It *was* a threat—but for once? It wasn’t aimed at *her.*
